instruction: Paul got a box of some crayons for his birthday. By the end of the school year he only had 291 crayons left since he had either lost or given away 315 of them. How many crayons did he get for his birthday?
output: A: He had 291 crayons left at the end of the school year. He had lost or given away 315 of them. That means he had 315 + 291 = 606 crayons in total. The answer is 606.

instruction: A book has 3 chapters. The first chapter is 91 pages long the second chapter is 23 pages long and the third chapter is 25 pages long. How many more pages does the first chapter have than the second chapter?

instruction: Danny has 21 bottle caps in his collection. He found some more bottle caps at the park. If he has 53 bottle caps now. How many bottle caps did he find at the park?
output: A: Danny had 21 bottle caps in his collection. Now he has 53 bottle caps. The difference must be the number of bottle caps he found at the park. So, he must have found 53 - 21 = 32 bottle caps. The answer is 32.

instruction: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 74 sacks per day and discard 71 of them. How many sacks of oranges will they have after 51 days of harvest?

instruction: Next on his checklist is wax to stick the feathers together and colors to paint them. He needs a total of 49 g of colors to paint them. If the feathers require 288 g of wax and right now he just needs 260 g. How many grams of wax does he already have?
output: A: He needs a total of 49 g of colors to paint the feathers. He needs 288 g of wax and he already has 260 g. That means he needs 288 - 260 = 28 g of wax. The answer is 28.

instruction: Lucy went to the grocery store. She bought 10 packs of cookie and 4 packs of cake. How many more packs of cookie did she buy over cake?
output: A: She bought 10 packs of cookie and 4 packs of cake. The difference between the two is 10 - 4 = 6 packs. She bought 6 more packs of cookie than cake. The answer is 6.

instruction: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 82 sacks of ripe oranges and 61 sacks of unripe oranges per day. How many sacks of ripe oranges will they have after 25 days of harvest?
output: A: They harvest 82 sacks of ripe oranges and 61 sacks of unripe oranges per day. In 25 days, they will have 25 * 82 = 2050 sacks of ripe oranges. The answer is 2050.

instruction: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have some sets of tables, each having the 3 chairs. If there are a total of 9 chairs in the backyard. How many sets of tables do they have?
output: A: Each set of tables has 3 chairs. That means there are 3 chairs per set. There are 9 chairs in total. So, the number of sets must be 9 / 3 = 3. The answer is 3.

instruction: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that the harvest will go on for 4 days. How many sacks do they harvest per day if they harvested a total of 56 sacks of oranges?
output: A: They harvested a total of 56 sacks of oranges. This means they harvested 56 sacks in 4 days. So, the number of sacks they harvest per day must be 56 / 4 = 14 sacks. The answer is 14.

instruction: A farmer had 175 tomatoes and 77 potatoes in his garden. If he picked 172 potatoes. How many tomatoes and potatoes does he have left?
output: A: The farmer had 175 tomatoes and 77 potatoes. He picked 172 potatoes, so now he has 77 - 172 = -95 potatoes. He still has 175 tomatoes. The answer is 175 tomatoes and -95 potatoes.

instruction: Jack received 5 emails in the morning, 8 emails in the afternoon and 72 emails in the evening. How many emails did Jack receive in the morning and afternoon?
output: A: Jack received 5 emails in the morning and 8 emails in the afternoon. So in total he received 5 + 8 = 13 emails in the morning and afternoon. The answer is 13.

instruction: White t - shirts can be purchased in packages. If mom buys 66 white t - shirts where each package has 3 white t - shirts. How many packages will she have?
output: A: Mom buys 66 white t - shirts. Each package has 3 white t - shirts. That means she needs 66 / 3 = 22 packages. The answer is 22.

instruction: A book has 3 chapters. The first chapter is 35 pages long the second chapter is 18 pages long and the third chapter is 3 pages long. How many more pages does the second chapter have than the third chapter?
output: A: The first chapter is 35 pages long, the second chapter is 18 pages long and the third chapter is 3 pages long. The difference between the second and third chapter is 18 - 3 = 15 pages. The answer is 15.

instruction: Bobby ate 28 pieces of candy. Then he ate 42 more. He also ate 63 pieces of chocolate. How many pieces of candy did Bobby eat?

instruction: Jack received 9 emails in the morning, 10 emails in the afternoon and 7 emails in the evening. How many more emails did Jack receive in the morning than in the evening?

instruction: There were 22 parents in the program and 676 people in total. How many pupils were present in the program?

instruction: Paco had 13 cookies. He ate 2 of them. Then he bought 36 more cookies. How many more cookies did he buy than those he ate?

instruction: The ring toss game at the carnival made 382 dollars in the first 44 days and 374 dollars in the remaining 10 days. How much did they make in all?

instruction: Lucy went to the grocery store. She bought 4 packs of cookie, 22 packs of cake and 16 packs of chocolate. How many packs of groceries did she buy in all?

instruction: Zachary did 35 push-ups and 3 crunches in gym class today. David did 58 more push-ups but 87 less crunches than zachary. How many more push-ups than crunches did Zachary do?
output: A: Zachary did 35 push-ups and 3 crunches. David did 58 more push-ups than Zachary, so he must have done 35 + 58 = 93 push-ups. He did 87 less crunches than Zachary, so he must have done 3 - 87 = -84 crunches. The difference between the number of push-ups and crunches that Zachary did is 35 - (-84) = 119. The answer is 119.

instruction: Debby bought 301 water bottles when they were on sale. If she drank 144 bottles a day for some days. If she has 157 bottles left. How many days did she drink for?
output: A: Debby bought 301 bottles. She drank 144 bottles a day for some days. Now she has 157 bottles left. That means 144 * x = 301 - 157, where x is the number of days she drank for. Solving for x, we get x = (301 - 157) / 144 = 2.5 days. The answer is 2.5 days.

instruction: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Together their strawberries weighed 4 pounds. Marco's strawberries weighed 19 pounds. How much more did his strawberries weigh than his dad's?
output: A: Together their strawberries weighed 4 pounds. Marco's strawberries weighed 19 pounds. That means his dad's strawberries weighed 4 - 19 = -15 pounds. This means Marco's strawberries weighed 15 pounds more than his dad's. The answer is 15.

instruction: There were 21 roses in the vase. Jessica threw away 34 roses from the vase and cut some more new roses from her flower garden to put in the vase. There are now 15 roses in the vase. How many more roses did she throw away than those she cut from her garden?

She cut some more roses from her garden and put them in the vase, so now there are 15 roses. That means she must have cut 15 - (-13) = 28 roses from her garden. The difference between the number of roses she threw away and the number of roses she cut from her garden is 34 - 28 = 6. The answer is 6.

instruction: Julia played tag with a total of 18 kids. She played with 4 kids on monday and yet with some more kids on tuesday. How many kids did she play with on tuesday?

instruction: Nell collects cards. She had 438 baseball cards and 18 Ace cards. She gave some of her cards to Jeff and now has 55 Ace cards and 178 baseball cards left. How many more baseball cards than Ace cards does Nell have?
output: A: Nell had 438 baseball cards and 18 Ace cards. After giving some cards to Jeff, she has 55 Ace cards and 178 baseball cards. The difference between the number of baseball cards and Ace cards is 178 - 55 = 123. So Nell has 123 more baseball cards than Ace cards. The answer is 123.

instruction: There were 8 people on the bus. At the next stop 12 more people got on the bus and 3 people got off. How many people are there on the bus now?
output: A: There were 8 people on the bus. 12 more people got on, so now there are 8 + 12 = 20 people. 3 people got off, so now there are 20 - 3 = 17 people. The answer is 17.

instruction: A grocery store had 67 bottles of regular soda and 9 bottles of diet soda. How many more bottles of regular soda than diet soda did they have?
output: A: The grocery store had 67 bottles of regular soda and 9 bottles of diet soda. The difference between the two is 67 - 9 = 58 bottles. The answer is 58.

instruction: A grocery store had 54 bottles of diet soda, 83 bottles of regular soda and 12 apples. How many more bottles of regular soda than diet soda did they have?
output: A: The grocery store had 54 bottles of diet soda and 83 bottles of regular soda. The difference between the two is 83 - 54 = 29 bottles. The answer is 29.

instruction: Baker made 62 cakes. Then he made 149 more cakes. He sold 144 of them. How many cakes would baker still have?
output: A: Baker made 62 cakes. Then he made 149 more cakes. So in total he made 62 + 149 = 211 cakes. He sold 144 of them, so he still has 211 - 144 = 67 cakes. The answer is 67.

instruction: Paul had 21 books. After selling some in a garage sale he bought 42 new ones. If he has 15 books now. How many more books did he sell than he bought?
output: A: Paul had 21 books. He sold some and bought 42 new ones. That means he sold 21 - 15 = 6 books. He bought 42 books. So he sold 6 more books than he bought. The answer is 6.

instruction: For Gwen's birthday she received 5 dollars from her dad. Her mom gave her 2 more dollars. If she spent 6 dollars. How much more money did she receive from her dad than she did from her mom?
output: A: Gwen received 5 dollars from her dad and 2 dollars from her mom. She spent 6 dollars. That means she had 5 + 2 = 7 dollars in total. She spent 6 dollars, so she has 7 - 6 = 1 dollar left. The difference between the money she received from her dad and her mom is 5 - 2 = 3 dollars. The answer is 3.

instruction: Brenda's mother made cookies for 5. She prepared 22 cookies but had to throw away 17 cookies. If each of them had the same number of cookies. How many did each of them have?
output: A: Brenda's mother made 22 cookies but had to throw away 17. That means she had 22 - 17 = 5 cookies left. Since there are 5 people, each of them must have had 5 / 5 = 1 cookie. The answer is 1.

instruction: Rachel had to complete 4 pages of reading homework, 7 pages of math homework and 19 more pages of biology homework. How many more pages of math homework than reading homework did she have?
output: A: Rachel had 4 pages of reading homework and 7 pages of math homework. The difference between these two is 7 - 4 = 3 pages. She also had 19 pages of biology homework. So the total difference between math and reading homework is 3 + 19 = 22 pages. The answer is 22.

instruction: Paul got a box of 440 crayons for his birthday. During the school year he gave 111 crayons to his friends while he lost 106 crayons. How many crayons did he have left?
output: A: Paul got a box of 440 crayons. He gave 111 to his friends, so now he has 440 - 111 = 329 crayons. He also lost 106 crayons, so now he has 329 - 106 = 223 crayons. The answer is 223.

instruction: Paul had 2 books. After selling some in a garage sale he bought 150 new ones. If he has 58 books now. How many books did he sell?
output: A: Paul had 2 books. After buying 150 new ones, he has 2 + 150 = 152 books. He has 58 books now, so he must have sold 152 - 58 = 94 books. The answer is 94.

instruction: Bobby ate 33 pieces of candy. Then he ate 4 more. He also ate 14 pieces of chocolate. How many pieces of candy and chocolate did Bobby eat altogether?
output: A: Bobby ate 33 pieces of candy and 14 pieces of chocolate. He then ate 4 more pieces of candy. So in total he ate 33 + 4 = 37 pieces of candy and 14 pieces of chocolate. The answer is 37 pieces of candy and 14 pieces of chocolate.

instruction: Baker made 14 cakes and 153 pastries. If he sold 8 pastries and 97 cakes. How many more cakes than pastries did baker sell?
output: A: Baker made 14 cakes and 153 pastries. He sold 97 cakes and 8 pastries. That means he sold 97 - 14 = 83 cakes more than pastries. The answer is 83.

instruction: Rachel had to complete 9 pages of math homework, 11 pages of reading homework and 29 more pages of biology homework. How many pages of math and reading homework did she have to complete?
output: A: Rachel had to complete 9 pages of math homework and 11 pages of reading homework. So in total she had to complete 9 + 11 = 20 pages of math and reading homework. The answer is 20.

instruction: The Razorback t-shirt shop makes $ 78 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas game and the Texas tech game they sold a total of 186 t-shirts. If they sold 172 t-shirts during the Arkansas game. How much money did they make from selling the t-shirts during the Texas tech game?
output: A: They sold a total of 186 t-shirts. 172 were sold during the Arkansas game. That means the remaining 186 - 172 = 14 t-shirts were sold during the Texas tech game. They make $78 off each t-shirt, so they made 14 * $78 = $1,092 from the Texas tech game. The answer is $1,092.

instruction: Edward spent $ 9. Then he spent $ 8 more. Now he has $ 17. How much did Edward have before he spent his money?
output: A: Edward has $17 now. He spent $8 more, so before that he must have had $17 - $8 = $9. He also spent $9 before that, so in total he had $9 + $9 = $18. The answer is 18.

instruction: For Gwen's birthday she received 8 dollars from her mom. Her dad gave her 5 more dollars. If she spent 4 dollars. How much more money did she receive from her mom than she did from her dad?
output: A: Gwen received 8 dollars from her mom and 5 dollars from her dad. She spent 4 dollars. That means she has 8 - 4 = 4 dollars from her mom and 5 - 4 = 1 dollar from her dad. The difference between the two is 4 - 1 = 3 dollars. The answer is 3.

instruction: Dan has $ 2. He bought some candy bar for $ 6 each one costing $ 3. How many candy bar did he buy?
output: A: Dan has $2. He bought candy bars for $6 each, so he must have bought 2 candy bars. 2 candy bars cost $6, so he spent $6 in total. He had $2 in the beginning, so now he has $2 - $6 = -$4. The answer is 2.

instruction: Jake has 7 fewer peaches than Steven and 9 more peaches than Jill. Steven has 16 peaches. How many peaches does Jake have?
output: A: Steven has 16 peaches. Jake has 7 fewer than Steven, so he has 16 - 7 = 9 peaches. Jill has 9 more than Jake, so she has 9 + 9 = 18 peaches. The answer is 9.

instruction: Rachel picked 7 apples from her tree. Thereafter 2 new apples grew on the tree. Now the tree has 6 apples still on it. How many apples did the tree have to begin with?
output: A: Rachel picked 7 apples from the tree. After that, 2 new apples grew on the tree. So in total 7 + 2 = 9 apples were on the tree. Now there are 6 apples left. That means 9 - 6 = 3 apples were picked. The answer is 3.

instruction: Haley grew 9 trees in her backyard. After a typhoon 4 died. Then she grew 5 more trees. How many trees does she have left?
output: A: She grew 9 trees in the beginning. After the typhoon 4 died, so she has 9 - 4 = 5 trees left. Then she grew 5 more trees, so now she has 5 + 5 = 10 trees. The answer is 10.

instruction: Haley grew 14 trees in her backyard. After a typhoon 9 died. How many more trees died in the typhoon than those that survived?
output: A: Haley grew 14 trees in her backyard. After the typhoon, 9 died. That means 9 trees died and 14 - 9 = 5 trees survived. The difference between the number of trees that died and the number of trees that survived is 9 - 5 = 4. The answer is 4.

instruction: Rachel had to complete 8 pages of math homework. If she had to complete 3 more pages of math homework than reading homework. How many pages did she have to complete in all?
output: A: She had to complete 8 pages of math homework. She had to complete 3 more pages of math homework than reading homework. That means she had to complete 8 + 3 = 11 pages of reading homework. In total she had to complete 8 + 11 = 19 pages of homework. The answer is 19.

instruction: Paul had 108 books. After selling some books in a garage sale and giving 35 books to his friend he had 62 books left. How many books did he sell in the garage sale?
output: A: Paul had 108 books. After giving 35 books to his friend, he had 108 - 35 = 73 books. He then sold some books in the garage sale. After that he had 62 books left. So he must have sold 73 - 62 = 11 books in the garage sale. The answer is 11.

instruction: Danny collects bottle caps and wrappers. He found 65 wrappers and 5 bottle caps at the park. Now he has 31 bottle caps and 9 wrappers in his collection. How many more wrappers than bottle caps did danny find at the park?
output: A: Danny found 65 wrappers and 5 bottle caps at the park. He now has 31 bottle caps and 9 wrappers in his collection. That means he has added 9 - 5 = 4 wrappers to his collection. The difference between the number of wrappers and bottle caps he found at the park must be 65 - 5 = 60. The answer is 60.

instruction: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 41 sacks of unripe oranges and 86 sacks of ripe oranges per day. How many more sacks of ripe oranges than unripe oranges are harvested per day?
output: A: There are 41 sacks of unripe oranges and 86 sacks of ripe oranges. The difference between them is 86 - 41 = 45 sacks. So, 45 more sacks of ripe oranges than unripe oranges are harvested per day. The answer is 45.

instruction: Frank was reading through his favorite book. The book had 193 pages equally distributed over 15 chapters. It took Frank 660 days to finish the book. How many chapters did he read per day?
output: A: The book has 193 pages and 15 chapters. This means each chapter has 193 / 15 = 13 pages. Frank took 660 days to finish the book. This means he read 13 pages per day. Since each chapter has 13 pages, he read 1 chapter per day. The answer is 1.
